sentences: Kodus olen ma ise enda peremees.
context: The Estonian word 'peremees' has multiple related meanings. It literally combines 'pere' (family) and 'mees' (man), so it originally referred to the head of a household or family. Over time, its meaning expanded to include owners/proprietors of property (houses, farms, businesses), landlords, hosts who entertain guests, and bosses in employment contexts. In biology, it also refers to a host organism for parasites. The word is masculine in form but can refer to both men and women in certain professional contexts.
